alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 8:31PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Wintery Weather and High Elevation Snow Will Take Us Into The Weekend... A strong and unseasonably cold storm system will affect the area through the first part of the weekend. Any rain showers which persist into the overnight will gradually mix with or change to snow showers. The vast majority of the area will remain above freezing overnight, and will not experience anything more than a temporary dusting of wet snow. However, the highest elevations at and above 2,500 feet, should experience some light snow accumulations which persist. From tonight through Saturday evening, the crest of Pine Mountain along the Little Shepherd Trail and Black Mountain could receive between 1 and 3 inches of snow. Slippery travel could occur at times on KY 160 between Lynch and the VA border. The precipitation should taper off Saturday evening, and skies will then clear Saturday night. This will set us up for temperatures near or below freezing by dawn on Sunday. Most places can expect frost at a minimum, and the possibility of temperatures dipping below 30 degrees.
